data.title: Hidden Attraction-watched a play
data.text:
This theatre is cute and cozy. Great place to hold plays for upcoming writers and directors. 
Nice spot. Area is a little rough looking but inside this theatre is a gem.

data.title: Camden's off Broadway
data.text: We were truly impressed and surprised by this amazing off Broadway theater across from Sacred Heart school in Camden. It was a true artistic experience. We saw a good play, were able to interact with the playwright. The venue is intimate but the small size of the theater makes one feel that much closer and more into the play itself. There is a little "bar'' serving coffee and snacks during the intermission and a small display of photos depicting the scenes from recent plays. The effort of having a theater in a city like Camden should not be underappreciated and does add another dimension to the experience. The parking can be a bit tricky but not if you come early - you can leave your car near the park. There are beautiful murals near-by. The immediate surrounding seems safe. The tickets were $20 but the parking is free.

data.title: Diamond in the rough
data.text: Right here in our own backyard, an intimate, professional and very active, up close and personal theater the brings to life classics as well as originals. We are blessed to have such an asset in the region for all of us to enjoy. More people should know about it, but at the same time I do not want to lose the quaintness of the little theater that could. You should go, it may surprise you.

data.title: Unique choices
data.text: This theatre of about 100 seats offers interesting - not seen everywhere- shows, and several by the artistic director.  Several were set in local South Jersey, particularly in Camden addressing the racial struggle as the ethnicity of the town changed.  The sets are amazing and very professionally done on a shoestring budget.  The theatre is located in the heart of Camden.  Some who aren't familiar with the area may choose not to attend as they are afraid of Camden in the evening.  We never had any problem.  There is a church across the street and we park in their parking lot.  The little neighborhood looks out for each other.  The theatre is ahead of its time as it waits for the waterfront to develop.

data.title: Great Little Community Theater Company
data.text: Having discovered this theater company online through visitnj.org, I decided to check it out for something different to do.  While it is not in the greatest of neighborhoods, it is still worth a visit.  The acting was great and the staff/volunteers were very pleasant.  I saw a production of Tennessee Williams' Kingdom of Earth.  It is a small theater that sits 96 people, which makes any seat intimate.  The ticket prices are reasonable as well.
